channel.title: Make characters talk
channel.description: i cant make the combat instructor talk i put in the scrip and everything but he doesnt talk

case 9158: is the second option your npc gives you

item.title: Make characters talk
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

In Client.Java I have;

/NPC Talking/
public void UpdateNPCChat() {
/sendFrame126("", 4902);
sendFrame126("", 4903);
sendFrame126("", 4904);
sendFrame126("", 4905);
sendFrame126("", 4906);/
sendFrame126("", 976);
switch (NpcDialogue) {
case 1:
/*sendFrame200(4901, 554);
sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4902);
sendFrame126(“You want some shit?”, 4904);
sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4901);
sendFrame164(4900);

Which makes it so when I talk to Aubury, he says “You want some shit?” in the box that covers the chat box.

Read full topic

item.title: Make characters talk
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Go into NpcHandler.java anf find:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 81 || npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) { if (misc.random2(50) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo"; } }

Under that put:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 944) { if (misc.random2(22) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Hi, I'm Mr. Combat Instructor"; } }

Search in that code and then you will get it.

Read full topic
